item.title: Diana add a quote by Charles Lindberg
item.description: "Life is like a landscape. You live in the midst of it, but can describe it only from the vantage point of distance." -- Charles Lindberg

item.title: Diana add a quote by Warren Bennis
item.description: "Taking charge of your own learning is a part of taking charge of your life, which is the <i>sine qua non</i> in becoming an integrated person." -- Warren Bennis

item.title: Diana add a quote by Frank Pittman
item.description: "Happy people learn that happiness, like sweat, is a by-product of activity. You can only achieve happiness if you are too busy living your life to notice whether you are happy or not." -- Frank Pittman

item.title: Diana add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "It is not the brains that matter most, but that which guides them — the character, the heart, generous qualities, progressive ideas." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Diana add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Neither man nor nation can exist without a sublime idea." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Diana add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Bodily exercise, when compulsory, does no harm to the body; but knowledge which is acquired under compulsion obtains no hold on the mind." -- Plato

item.title: Diana add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "The responsibility of tolerance lies in those who have the wider vision." -- George Eliot

item.title: Diana add a quote by Andrew Carnegie
item.description: "People who are unable to motivate themselves must be content with mediocrity, no matter how impressive their other talents." -- Andrew Carnegie

item.title: Diana add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "What was any art but an effort to make a sheath, a mold in which to imprison for a moment the shining, elusive element which is life itself." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Diana add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "Everything's already been said, but since nobody was listening, we have to start again." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Diana add a quote by Douglas Jerrold
item.description: "Readers are of two sorts: one who goes carefully through a book, and the other who as carefully lets the book go through him. " -- Douglas Jerrold

item.title: Diana add a quote by Etty Hillesum
item.description: "Become simple and live simply, not only within yourself but also in your everyday dealings. Don’t make ripples all around you, don’t try to be interesting, keep your distance, be honest, fight the desire to be thought fascinating by the outside world." -- Etty Hillesum

item.title: Diana add a quote by Frederico Fellini
item.description: "A different language is a different vision of life." -- Frederico Fellini

item.title: Diana add a quote by Richard Whately
item.description: "Curiosity is as much the parent of attention, as attention is of memory." -- Richard Whately

item.title: Diana add a quote by Arthur Helps
item.description: "Reading is sometimes an ingenious device for avoiding thought." -- Arthur Helps

item.title: Diana add a quote by Thornton Wilder
item.description: "Seek the lofty by reading, hearing and seeing great work at some moment every day. " -- Thornton Wilder

item.title: Diana add a quote by Lorrie Moore
item.description: "Writers have no real area of expertise. They are merely generalists with a highly inflamed sense of punctuation." -- Lorrie Moore

item.title: Diana add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "There is no expedient to which a man will not go to avoid the real labor of thinking." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Diana add a quote by Bill Barich
item.description: "A good writer refuses to be socialized. He insists on his own version of things, his own consciousness. And by doing so he draws the reader's eye from its usual groove into a new way of seeing things." -- Bill Barich

item.title: Diana add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Novelists have, on the average, about the same IQs as the cosmetic consultants at Bloomingdale’s department store. Our power is patience. We have discovered that writing allows even a stupid person to seem halfway intelligent, if only that person will write the same thought over and over again, improving it just a little bit each time. It is a lot like inflating a blimp with a bicycle pump. Anybody can do it. All it takes is time." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Diana add a quote by Nadia Boulanger
item.description: "Life is denied by lack of attention, whether it be to cleaning windows or trying to write a masterpiece." -- Nadia Boulanger

item.title: Diana add a quote by Thomas Huxley
item.description: "God give me strength to face a fact though it slay me." -- Thomas Huxley
